content.description: Toadstool 5.8After a Clean up of the Area and Rock itself there was small Piece of Graffiti left behind .. On the Bottom Left Side of Spruce Brook Boulder: The Start of this route's first obvious Hold makes for a challenging beginning and follows through that way as you move up to a small shelf. Transition Up and Slightly Right finding a selection of holds to get over a larger shelf area big enough to sit on .Reposition to make the Final Top out to the Left of the Main Top anchor Bars
content.protection: Top Anchor Bars -a short length of Chain helps reduce angle

content.description: Swingers and Clingers 5.6   Starting on The Bottom Right Section of Spruce Brook Boulder, you follow the arete that forms between the Main Back Face of the Boulder,  and the Right-hand Side of the boulder, adjacent the Large Tree.  Using The Edge for holds Move up the bulge that protrudes out and slightly towards you.    If Not Sport Climbing its best to use the anchors on the face of the Boulder as they are set further on the Right; At this point anticipate a swing if you come off .. Past here there are a few options for holds with combinations of smaller crimps and pockets to utilize as you move to the upper section Transition over the Small Roof to the Top .  Any other INfo or others Climbing in NSF Please feel free to reach out at  #NorEasterExposure or NorEasterExposure@gmail.com      William Cirillo
content.protection: Some Bolts as well as  / Anchor Bolts on Face / Alternate - Anchor Bars On Top
content.location: Spruce Brook Boulder Parking Lot / Upper Parking Lot at the End of Dirt Rd access

content.description: Fraggle Rock 5.7+A Sport Climb Route Up the Center section of the rock .This is the Primary Route on Spruce Brook Boulder. Starting With multiple holds down low you work your way up and to the Right where you transition at what looks to be a Fin   Past this move seems to be the Crux, Then moving Straight Up and to the upper section finding multiple hold options below a small roof feature.  Finally traversing left below the roof and moving on top of a large shelf , big enough to sit on, before again finding different Topping Out Options.
content.protection: Bolts and Anchor On Top Side but a small length of Chain Recommended
content.location: Left Side Of Upper Parking Area There is a small trail but you will see the boulder by then.

content.description: Spruce Creek BoulderIs an Easy Access 30FT plus Glacial Boulder that is top rope friendly with Two anchor options.One being easily accessed from walking up and around the frontside and best utilized with a small length of chain;The rock is Sharp Schist and the anchor points are setback pretty far.The other more traditional anchor option is slightly offset and located on the main face of the Boulder making harder to Top Accessbut a nice option for the Sport Route.With Three Main Routes on Left, Center, and Right Side on the Back Face of the BoulderThere is also one sport route, The primary Route up the Middle Fraggle RockThe Rock here is a bit sharp in places but solid, with a variety of different style holds making for good short climbs.Any other INfo or others Climbing in NSF Please feel free to reach out at or #NorEasterExposure or NorEasterExposure@gmail.comWilliam Cirillo
